description: An example resource schema demonstrating some basic constructs and validation rules.

EndpointConfiguration.description: The configuration for a given endpoint

EndpointId.description: Id of the endpoint.  For Network/Application Load Balancer this value is the ARN.  For EIP, this value is the allocation ID.  For EC2 instances, this is the EC2 instance ID

ClientIPPreservationEnabled.description: true if client ip should be preserved

ListenerArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener

EndpointGroupRegion.description: The name of the AWS Region where the endpoint group is located

TrafficDialPercentage.description: The percentage of traffic to sent to an AWS Region

HealthCheckPort.description: The port that AWS Global Accelerator uses to check the health of endpoints in this endpoint group.

HealthCheckProtocol.description: The protocol that AWS Global Accelerator uses to check the health of endpoints in this endpoint group.

HealthCheckIntervalSeconds.description: The time in seconds between each health check for an endpoint.  Must be a value of 10 or 30

ThresholdCount.description: The number of consecutive health checks required to set the state of the endpoint to unhealthy.

EndpointGroupArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group
